title: german blackletter
content:
hey guys,  
i'm working on a book about espionage during WWII.  
i would like to use a typeface like this for the title.  
can anyone identify this type or something close.  
thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085136im_/http:/typophile.com/files/colony_5439.jpg)
author: bphil00

comments.content:
Hi Brian,

that’s similar to [Element](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085136/http:/www.romana-hamburg.de/fraktur6.htm), [Potsdam](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085136/http:/moorstation.org/typoasis/blackletter/htm/potsdam.htm) or [Tannenberg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085136/http:/www.fraktur.com/) (\> Gotisch \> scroll down).  
F

See also [Schaftstiefelgrotesk](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085136/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Schaftstiefelgrotesk). Additionally, you can [search the Global Type database](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085136/http:/www.global-type.org/Searching.743.0.html) for old metal faces like National or Deutschland. But your sample might aswell be handlettered, of course.
thanks Florian, this is very helpful
Or stroll through the work of [Dieter Steffmann](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019085136/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/steffmann/index.htm).
